title: Mumbaikars feel the heat as city witnesses season’s hottest day at 38.8 degree celsius - India News | The Financial Express
text:
Mumbai remained hot for the second consecutive day as the city witnessed above 38 degrees on Thursday.
Temperature in Mumbai The Santacruz observatory of the Indian Meteorology Department (IMD) recorded 38.8 degrees Celsius, showcasing a significant deviation from the normal temperature as it was six degrees above normal. The day was marked as the hottest day of the ongoing season and it was the highest day temperature recorded during March.
A day earlier, the Santacruz observatory had recorded 38.7 degrees.

Similarly, IMD’s coastal observatory at Colaba registered 36.3 degrees on Thursday and 34.3 degrees on Wednesday.
Moreover, on Thursday, Mumbai saw the warmest night temperature across the state with Santacruz observatory noting 24 degrees celsius and Colaba observatory recording 21.4 degree celsius, according to Indian express.
Sunil Kamble, scientist and head of IMD, Mumbai said that IMD is not contemplating on issuing any heatwave warning for now even though there has been a rise in temperature.

The temperature surge has been recorded due to easterly distribution of winds, which the city is experiencing. The city may record a drop in temperature from tomorrow (Friday) onwards as Westerly winds are expected to prevail due to change in wind direction, Kamble told Indian Express on Thursday.
